content.rendered:
This month’s SSOM celebrates all things pride with “Pride on Main.” Watch dudes in high heels bolt down Main at the DragÂ Races or watch leather-clad ladies scoot their way to the finish lineÂ at theÂ Tryke Races.

Pride on Main is presented by Below Zero Lounge.Â All proceeds from the Drag Races and Tryke Races benefit Pride 2015. Tips from the Cincinnati Sports Leagues Beer GardenÂ will be donated to Caracole, ourÂ beer ambassadors in July.

SSOM runs 12-5 PM in historic Over-The-Rhine and is always free and open to the public.

Take aÂ look at what you can expect this Sunday (and join our official FacebookÂ event for updates).

12:30 PM Old Green Eyes (jazz duo) – MOTR Stage

http://www.oldgreeneyes.com/

1:45 PM Missed OTR Drag Queen Contest – MOTR Stage

Watch contestants perform a song and dance number. The audience favorite will be crowned the next â€œMissed OTR.â€ Contestants must register by July 11.

2:00 PM Tryke Races – MOTR Stage

A Big Wheels tricycle, vest, hat and sunglasses provided. Teams of four ladies compete. $40 entry fee per team.

2:45 PM Cincinnati Menâ€™s Chorus – MOTR Stage

http://www.cincinnatimenschorus.org/

3:00 PM Annual Drag Races – MOTR Stage

Teams provide their own wigs, slip-on dresses, handbag and heels (no slip-ons, must be at least 2â€ high); teams of four compete; $40 entry fee per team. Open registration for last-minute teams opens at 1:30 PM.

* Early registration for the races and Missed OTR pageant is encouraged. Contact Brooklyn Steele-Tate at CotrellM@gmail.com to register.

4:00 PM Hugh Bob and The Hustle (country) – MOTR Stage

http://hughbobandthehustle.bandcamp.com/

Plus:

â— Art on the Streetsâ€™ ArtWalks community crosswalk painting project atÂ Melindy & Main (moved from Liberty & Main)
â— Cincinnati Sports Leagues Beer Garden featuring Rivertown Brewing
â— Music and street performers at the Art on the Streets tent (near Orchard & Main) and Rock Paper Scissors tent (near 13th & Main)
â— Celebrity Chef Demo at Mr. Pitifulâ€™s. Demo by Proprietor/Chef Jose Salazar of Salazar; Cocktails by bartenders Andrew Rettig and Steven Clement. Doors open at 2 PM. Chef demos start at 2:30 PM. FREE – no reservation required; first-come, first-seated.

Art on the Streets performance tent (near Orchard & Main Street)

12:00-1:30 PM Allison Bishop and Mark Campbell (of the Archers) (Folk Pop Duo playing acoustic covers and quirky originals)
1:45-3:15 PM Terri Burch and Hoop Roots, Inc. (hula hoopers – come watch the pros and join in a hooping party)
3:30-5:00 PM Ben Hershorin (acoustic indie and blues riffs)

Rock Paper Scissors performance tent (near 13th & Main Street)

12:00-12:45 PM Jari Piper (neo-classical cello)
1:00-1:45 PM Equator Bear (jazz folk)
2:00-2:45 PM Elia Goat (nomadic folk)
3:00-3:45 PM Moriah Haven Lawson (bluegrass / soul)
4:00-5:00 PM Nancy Paraskevopoulos (raw folk)

Other highlights:Â 

  • Browse Main Streetâ€™s shops, galleries, and restaurants (check out our roundup of this month’s SSOM specials!)
  • Grab lunchÂ from the Main Street restaurants and cafes,Â food trucks, and vendors
  • Enjoy a cold Rivertown beer or Miller Lite from the Cincinnati Sports LeaguesÂ Beer Garden
  • Relax with some live music and street performers at the Art on the Streets tent and Rock Paper Scissors tent
  • Peruse art,Â sweet treats, vintage housewares, handmade soaps, antiques, and more fromÂ over 100 local vendors
  • Pick up some fine art and handmade goods created by current Art Academy students at the AAC mARTket

Thanks to our sponsorsÂ for all their support! We couldn’t be here withoutÂ Rosemary and Mark Schlachter, Cincinnati Sports Leagues, 3CDC, Main Street OTR, MOTR Pub, Over-The-Rhine Chamber of Commerce, Urban Sites, Yelp, UrbanCincy.com, WVXU, Below Zero Lounge, Enjoy The Arts, Pallet23, Art Academy of Cincinnati and Lightborne.
